alert.note: Alert for Buffalo; Dewey; Hughes; Hyde; Jones; Lyman; Potter; Stanley; Sully (South Dakota) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Aberdeen (Northern and Northeastern South Dakota)
info.headline: Extreme Fire Danger issued April 05 at 3:13AM MDT by NWS Aberdeen
info.description: .DISCUSSION... A Red Flag Warning remains in effect for south central and central South Dakota from 1 PM CDT to 7 PM CDT this evening due to low relative humidity and gusty winds. Strong northwesterly winds with gusts of 40 to 50 mph can be expected today. The highest winds will occur over south central and central South Dakota where afternoon RH values will drop below 25 percent. These conditions will cause very high to extreme grassland fire danger. The winds should relax some tonight, especially along and east of the James River. Increasing chances for wetting rainfall tonight into Wednesday, along with cooler temperatures will improve humidity values on Wednesday. Unfortunately, strong northerly winds can be expected once again on Wednesday with gusts of 40 to 50 mph possible for most areas. ...EXTREME FIRE DANGER... Extreme weather conditions and very low moisture content of grasses, and other dry organic material on the ground, indicate that critical burning conditions exist. All fires have the potential to become large and spread quickly becoming erratic with extreme behavioral characteristics. The outlook for Wednesday afternoon...The grassland fire danger index will reach the very high to extreme category.
